content: Hey, I’m Rahul. I’m in my final year of engineering and feeling super stressed lately.
Hi Rahul, thanks for sharing that with me. What’s been stressing you out the most?
Mostly exams and placements. I love late-night studying but it’s ruining my sleep.
I usually listen to lo-fi music while studying, it calms me down a bit.
Lo-fi can be really relaxing. How many hours of sleep are you getting on average?
Barely 5 hours. I know it’s bad but I feel more productive late at night.
Also, I really enjoy sci-fi movies and anime. That’s how I relax on weekends.
Nice, sci-fi and anime are great escapes. Do you usually watch alone or with friends?
Mostly alone. I stay in a hostel away from family, so I don’t meet friends that often.
Sometimes I feel a bit lonely, to be honest. That’s why I like chatting like this.
I’m glad you feel comfortable talking here. What usually makes you feel better on tough days?
Going for a late-night walk, listening to music, or just journaling my thoughts.
Do you enjoy journaling frequently?
Yes, especially when I’m overwhelmed.
That sounds like a healthy coping mechanism.
Sometimes I sleep late because I lose track of time while studying.
Do late-night study sessions help you focus better?
Yes, the campus is quiet and I feel more productive.
Do you ever nap during the day?
Rarely. I usually just push through the day.
How often do you watch sci-fi or anime?
Almost every weekend, it helps me relax.
Do you talk to your friends or family about stress?
Not much, I don’t want to worry them.
How do you usually feel after journaling?
Much lighter, like my thoughts are clearer.
Do you enjoy any hobbies apart from movies?
I sometimes draw or doodle when I'm free.
That’s wonderful. Creative hobbies can be emotionally grounding.
True, but I don’t get a lot of time during exam season.
